poem:
**After Fifteen Years**

The air thickens with anticipation,
Liverpool hums with the murmurs of red banners
like eager hearts, fluttering.
Ellie speaks, an echo of Harman's stride,
and somewhere in No 10,
a shadow of cautious triumph dances,
wondering how much hope
a minister can hold
before it spills
over the edges of history.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Labour will lean into hope at first conference in power for 15 years When Ellie Reeves opens Labour conference, she will be the first Labour minister to do so since Harriet Harman walked off the stage in Brighton 15 years ago. For the 20,000 Labour supporters flocking to Liverpool this year, it is in many ways the first chance at a victory party. In No 10, there is a dilemma about how much ministers can". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
